intro: Fosterella bodoquenensis, commonly known as the Bodoquen fosterella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its compact rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking inflorescences with bright red flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
